description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the denial of service vulnerability in the Windows mobile broadband driver (CVE-2024-43557), it is essential to apply the relevant updates as follows:

1. Identify your Windows version and build number from the list below:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2: Build 10.0.26100.2033
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: Build 10.0.22631.4317
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: Build 10.0.22621.4317
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: Build 10.0.22000.3260
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: Build 10.0.19045.5011
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: Build 10.0.19044.5011

2. Download and apply the respective update packages based on your version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2, apply KB5044284: [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2, apply KB5044285: [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2, apply KB5044285: [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2, apply KB5044280: [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2, apply KB5044273: [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2, apply KB5044273: [Download](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)

**Details**:
- These updates address improper input validation and out-of-bounds reads that could lead to a denial of service.
- It is crucial to restart your system post installation for the updates to take effect.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure that your system is on a compatible Windows build before proceeding with the update.
- Back up critical data to prevent loss during the update process.
